intro: Euphrasia hirtella f. macrantha, commonly known as the hairy eyebright, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, upright stems and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are hairy and opposite, and the flowers bloom from late spring to early summer. Euphrasia hirtella f. macrantha is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
